basics.name: Jiawei Zhang
basics.label: Data Scientist & Ph.D. Researcher
basics.summary: Data Science Ph.D. student focusing on LLMs and causal inference while maintaining scikit-learn.

work.summary: Advancing the Hierarchical Reasoning Model for self-evolving AGI and integrating visual autoregressive modeling to improve adaptive planning.
highlights: Designed reasoning pipelines that couple HRM with spatiotemporal world models.
Explored VAR-based modules that boost predictive reasoning and planning stability.

work.summary: Maintain and extend core machine learning components, shape release planning, and support new contributors.
highlights: Created BayesSearchCV and delivered Gaussian Mixture and preprocessing improvements adopted in releases.
Served as a triage team member, guiding contributor onboarding, testing, and review workflows.

work.summary: Improved reliability and metadata propagation in the core pandas data analysis library.
highlights: Resolved multi-year metadata propagation regressions impacting production workloads.
Delivered fixes now included in the mainline library.

work.summary: Co-developed Imputation-Assisted Randomization Tests for causal inference with missing outcomes.
highlights: Authored theoretical guarantees and algorithms for covariate-adjusted randomization tests.
Released open-source Python and R implementations adopted by collaborating research teams.

work.summary: Modeled heterogeneous treatment effects at scale to inform individualized clinical decisions.
highlights: Analyzed 700k+ study cases to estimate personalized risks for bariatric surgery candidates.
Constructed confidence intervals that supported updates to ASMBS guidelines.

work.summary: Built speech and language prototypes for consumer music products.
highlights: Developed ASR and TTS models to improve lyric transcription accuracy.
Implemented smart lyrics features that integrated with large-scale music platforms.

education.summary: Undergraduate studies combining mathematics, computer science, and business.

awards.title: National Olympiad of Informatics in Province — First Prize
awards.summary: Top provincial award recognizing algorithmic programming excellence.

projects.name: GFlowNet Finetuning for Diverse Generation
projects.summary: Developed a GFlowNet-based approach to increase diversity in open-ended LLM generation, outperforming RL baselines on creative benchmarks.

projects.name: python-iArt / iArt
projects.summary: Open-source Python and R packages providing Imputation-Assisted Randomization Tests for causal inference with missing outcomes.

publications.name: From Division to Unity: A Large-Scale Study on the Emergence of Computational Social Science, 1990–2021
publications.summary: Analyzes three decades of publication data to uncover convergence dynamics in computational social science (co-first author).

publications.name: Design-based causal inference with missing outcomes: missingness mechanisms, imputation-assisted randomization tests, and covariate adjustment
publications.publisher: Journal of the American Statistical Association (Theory and Methods)
publications.summary: Introduces imputation-assisted randomization tests and covariate adjustment techniques for causal inference with missing outcomes (co-first author).

teaching.course: DATA 22100 Introduction to Machine Learning: Concepts and Applications
teaching.description: Led labs and discussion sessions covering supervised/unsupervised learning, model evaluation, and responsible ML.

teaching.course: GPH-GU 2363 Causal Inference: Design and Analysis
teaching.description: Supported course delivery on design-based causal inference, randomized experiments, and sensitivity analyses.
